Description: Part of a bracelet of grey metasediment: amounting to just under half the original circumference. The outer edge is rounded and the inner surface is flat, producing a semicircular section.
Curator's comments: Bears the excavator's mark, P. Bibliography: E. Naville, ‘The cemeteries of Abydos’ I (London, 1913), 39; B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' V (Oxford: Clarendon Press), 81; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II (London, 1901)pl. XLV, 10. For similar objects, see E. Amélineau, ‘Les Nouvelles Fouilles d’Abydos’ III, (1897-8), pl.II; A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens’ II (Berlin, 1929-31), no. 204, (1); W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II (London, 1901), pls.XXXV, 54; XXXVII, 47; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' I (London, 1902), 17; G. A. Reisner, 'The early dynastic cemeteries of Naga-ed-Dêr' I, (California, 1908), 118, and pls. 9d, 41b; W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' III (London, 1958), 82 and pl. 100b; Z. Y. Saad, 'The excavations at Helwan art and civilization in the first and second Egyptian dynasties' (Norman, 1969), pls. 78, 82, 83.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (168)
